summary: The Protecting Students with Disabilities Act (H.R. 2333) aims to prevent the Department of Education from eliminating, consolidating, or restructuring offices that administer programs under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA). The bill also prohibits altering the responsibilities of personnel in these offices or contracting out program administration to external entities. The act reinforces Congress's intent to protect the existing framework for special education programs within the Department of Education.
